definition: simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: Your boss is so verbose, his speech should be concise and comprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 你們老闆也太羅嗦了，應該言簡意賅一點。

sentences.english: None of that jello crap. Mama needs to get her buzz on.
sentences.chinese: 廢話少說，媽媽得學會言簡意賅了。

sentences.english: If need be, be mostly silent or speak sparingly.
sentences.chinese: 如果需要，最好保持靜默或言簡意賅。

sentences.english: The real thing in writing, concise and comprehensive word neat.
sentences.chinese: 寫法真實事道破，言簡意賅字利落。

definition: to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
study of classic texts, including interpretation, glossaries and commentaries
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
to express or convey one's ideas
pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
epistemology (in philosophy, the theory of how we know things)
